sentences: Josefina Brdlíková née Mourková (20 March 1843   – 21 April 1910) was a translator, singer, pianist and composer.
She was born in Prague, and studied music in Paris and London.
She married the mayor and industrialist Jan Brdlík, who was a founder of coal tar chemical factories, and lived in Počátky until 1899.
In 1894 her husband opened a new branch of his business and the couple moved to Kralupy.
After her husband died, Brdlíková returned to Prague, where she studied astronomy and languages.
